PatientDetails.Name: Joanna Sprague
HospitalCourse: Admitted on 09/19/2024 with NSTEMI complicated by cardiogenic shock.
Extubated on 09/28/2024 then re-intubated the same day due to poor secretion management.
Current status critically ill, intubated, with ongoing support and severe weakness.

Medications: Dual antiplatelet therapy: Aspirin 81 mg daily, Ticagrelor 90 mg twice daily
Milrinone IV infusion for cardiac support
ElectronicMedicalRecords.HospitalDischarge: Discharged on 10/05/2024 but with a grim prognosis.

InfectionIndicators.UnexplainedHypoxia: Sustained oxygen levels above 90% with ventilation, but struggled with spontaneous breathing trials.

Sepsis.ClinicalNotes: Signs of possible infection indicated by leukocytosis and new fevers, but cultures remain unyielding for specific pathogens.

BloodProducts.HemoglobinLevels: 9.4 (low), previously 7.4 (low) at one point during hospitalization.
BloodProducts.TransfusionEvents: Patient received blood transfusions to maintain hemoglobin above 8 in light of cardiac disease.
